projects.title: Single-piece glasses case
projects.description: Made from a single block of chestnut, this glasses case is decorated with a little gold penguin - a nod to the Linux mascot, Tux, and my day job as a software developer. The case has a felt and cork lining and a magnetic closure for safe keeping.

projects.title: Tablet device e-Charger
projects.description: A single block of teak, but hiding inside a fully-functional 15w wireless charging unit. Decorated with a floral pattern in vinyl, the e-Charger can wirelessly recharge any current-model phone or tablet with wireless-charging enabled, upto a size of around 9-inches.

projects.title: Custom rabbit hutch
projects.description: Custom rabbit hutch with fully removable flooring for easy cleaning, plus three access doors. Rabbit privacy is ensured thanks to a comfortable, ventilated concealed section. The build is finished with food-safe Osmo oil and stainless steel hardware for hinges, door clasps and hutch wire.

projects.title: Japanese-style tool box
projects.description: A wooden tool box, built from solid cherry wood with ash features. Actually, the top lid is hinged, which distinguishes it from the genuine Japanese tradition for tool boxes (and which use a wedge arrangement to close the box and keep it shut). It features a pull handle on the front of the box and a subset drawer on steel runners.

projects.title: Zen garden
projects.description: A simple box with accompanying tool holder fopr a decorative - and relaxing - oriental-style zen garden.

projects.title: Tooth fairy box
projects.description: A small box crafted from a solid block of beech wood. It's tiny, of course, made for storing teeth for when the tooth fairy comes to visit and features inlaid brass hinges and dual magnetic closures.

projects.title: Built-in closet shoe-rack
projects.description: Standing just over two metres in height and built to measure inside a walk-in closet, this piece features a series of extractable shoe shelves as well as an additional upper storage area.

projects.title: Kitchen knife stand
projects.description: A kitchen knife stand with embedded molybdenum magnets and a protective plexiglass frontal piece.

projects.title: Axolotyl desk decoration
projects.description: A playful piece made from cut-offs of another project and existing purely to bring a smile to axolotyl lovers' faces.

projects.title: Veneered box-beam coffee table
projects.description: A tricky piece, both to make and in appearance. This box-beam table has clean lines and - apparently - mitred joins, but such joins could never support the weight of the table top (or even a minimal load). Underneath its gnarly oaken veneer (which is real oak veneer - not vinyl) is a simple morttice and tenon framework which gives it strength to match its beauty. It sits on a narrower drop stand to give the additional illusion of floating in space.

projects.title: Fanciful coffee coasters
projects.description: Simple coasters, entirely cut and shaped by hand (files, rasps, straight saw cuts) and decorated with transfer-on humourous messages.

projects.title: Meditation table
projects.description: Cherry meditation table in Indian style, with dovetailed draw and featuring a single-board solid cherry top. The legs appear to be butt-jointed but in fact are supported by hardwood dowels extending 1/3 of the way along the length of each leg for extraordinary supprt.

projects.title: Kitchen implement holder
projects.description: Two-layered vintage-style kitchen utensil holder in oak with vinyl lettering. It features a large raised compartment for longer utensils as well as a shallower front section for smaller odds and ends.

projects.title: House nightlight
projects.description: Multi-colored LED light ensconced in a beech house with windows to enable light passage and so it can serve as a nightlight.

projects.title: Pan-lid holder
projects.description: Kitchen pan-lid holder with curved profile made with half-finger joints.

projects.title: Router plane
projects.description: A completely custom router (or grooving) plane with screw-adjustable depth stop and iron mechanism.

projects.title: Masonry hammer
projects.description: This was a 1930s masonry hammer, rusted and with a broken tenon. I replaced the handle with the same essence of timber and reground the original shape of the head. As always with these kind of projects, I embedded a portion of the original wood into the new handle so it "carries with it" something of its history.

projects.title: Stanley handplane restoration
projects.description: 1960s Stanley #4 handplane, bought 12th-hand from eBay and restored. Rear tote was beyond repair, so I fashioned a new one and accompanying knob from cherry.

projects.title: Bedside lamp
projects.description: Inspired by the treehouse look, this bedside table lamp for children features a USB LED light with multiple color settings and a patterned series of roof holes that, at nighttime, create pretty patterns of light on nearby surfaces.

projects.title: Art box and foldable easel
projects.description: Foldable easel and artist's carry case for paints, brushes and other materials. Features an adjustable canvas support and divisible storage section.

projects.title: Side table
projects.description: Side table in cherry with walnut shelf-rack and detailing.

projects.title: Japanese style workbench
projects.description: Lighweight workbench in the Japanese style, with single side vice, bench dogs and a  tapered through-tenon leg design to ensure joint strength even as the wood ages.

projects.title: Crayon holder
projects.description: Colorful crayon-holder with appliquè lettering in vinyl, suitable for up to 21 large wax crayons.

projects.title: Teddy bed
projects.description: Removable mini-bedside table with fixed-position toy bed (complete with bedclothes) for a favourite teddy bear.

projects.title: Toy laptop PC
projects.description: Chalkboard laptop toy, with "mouse" eraser. Also features a real keyboard from a disused Asus laptop, for realistic typing.

projects.title: Memory game with box
projects.description: Wooden memory card set game, featuring transferred images of various cartoon characters, particularly Disney princesses. The game is accompanied by a simple butted wooden box from lime wood.

projects.title: Oak console
projects.description: Simple oak, single cupboard, single-drawer console cabinet with mitred floating-panel door and upper-drawer with sharknose finger-pull.

projects.title: Cuckoo wall light
projects.description: Wall light inspired by the high-angled Swiss cuckoo clocks and made from mahogany and ash timber. Contains LED light wired via mains socket.

projects.title: Study desk
projects.description: Two-drawer study desk with in-built desk lamp and multiplug. It also features additional shelving within its right leg.

projects.title: Workbench
projects.description: Workbench featuring single side-clamp and floating lower shelf for additional storage.

projects.title: Adjustable iPad stand
projects.description: Two-tone iPad stand with charging cable runway and stainless steel hardware for 60° height/viewing angle adjustment.

projects.title: Bedside table with secret compartment
projects.description: A bedside table built with a secret, hidden compartment; heart-shaped hardware, built-in anti-spill cup-holder and featuring single-dowetail drawer.

projects.title: Wooden anglepoise desk lamp
projects.description: Wooden Anglepoise with just a hint of the steampunk about it.

projects.title: Keepsake box
projects.description: Keepsake box using finger joints and an indwelling lid feature to seal the box closed. It doesn't look like much but it was the first project I made from wood which required no nails or screws and so it was an important milestone for my woodwork.
